datafield.subfield: Investigation into the Soil-Root Composites Using Distinct Element Method

Tree roots play an important role in slope slide prevention. In order to explore the reinforcement mechanism of pine roots in shallow slopes, a series of direct shear testsDirect shear test were carried out using Distinct Element Method (DEM). Firstly, the pine root is simulated with an assembly of bonded particles in which parallel bond model is used. Then, a series of direct shear testsDirect shear test on the soil-pine root compositesComposite were conducted to analyze the effects of the normal stress, the distribution and the amount of the pine roots on the shear strengthShear strength . The DEM results show that the pine roots in the sand can enhance the shear strengthShear strength significantly, the shear strengthShear strength of the pine root-soil compositesComposite increases with the increasing normal stress, the increasing pine root number and the decreasing root inclination angle.
